question: A PHP script should start with ___ and end with ___.
A function in PHP which starts with __ (double underscore) is know as..
Which one of the following can be used to instantiate an object in PHP assuming class name to be Foo?
Which one of the following is the right description for the method getMessage() ?
a: Returns the message if it is passed to the constructor
b: Returns the message if it is passed to the class
c: Returns the message if it is passed to the file
d: Returns the message if it is passed to the object
answer: Returns the message if it is passed to the constructor

Which of the following is true about php variables?
a: Variables can, but do not need, to be declared before assignment.
b: Variables in PHP do not have intrinsic types - a variable does not know in advance whether it will be used to store a number or a string of characters.
c: Variables used before they are assigned have default values.
